decks.notes: This deck focuses on playing a proactive game plan that combines aggressive creatures like Dreadhorde Arcanist and Monastery Mentor with disruptive spells like Pyroblast and Force of Will. It aims to control the game by countering opposing threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through cards like Ancestral Recall and Treasure Cruise. The deck also utilizes powerful synergies such as Dreadhorde Arcanist's ability to recast spells from the graveyard and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade's ability to disrupt opponents' mana development. Overall, the deck aims to pressure opponents while maintaining control of the game.

The deck is focused on assembling the combo of casting Doomsday and using its ability to stack the perfect 5-card library to win the game. It contains cantrips and card draw spells to find the combo pieces quickly and protection spells to ensure it resolves. The deck also includes tutors like Demonic Tutor and Vampiric Tutor to find specific cards when needed. The key strategy is to efficiently dig through the deck, set up the winning library with Doomsday, and win the game with Thassa's Oracle.

The main concept of this Vintage 1 vs 1 Combo - Dredge deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Golgari Grave-Troll, Stinkweed Imp, and Shambling Shell, triggering effects that bring back creatures like Narcomoeba and Prized Amalgam. Cards like Cabal Therapy and Creeping Chill disrupt the opponent's game plan while using Force of Will and other counter spells for protection. Bazaar of Baghdad is used to throw cards into the graveyard, fueling the Dredge mechanic. Bridge from Below provides additional creature tokens and Wasteland/Strip Mine disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The deck focuses on slowing down the opponent's plays while ramping up its own mana production and deploying powerful threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Golos, Tireless Pilgrim. It utilizes artifact creatures and disruptive permanents like Phyrexian Revoker and Sphere of Resistance to maintain control of the game. The deck also includes cards like Crucible of Worlds and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats and lock them out of the game with disruptive artifacts.

This deck focuses on using the graveyard to quickly and efficiently bring back powerful creatures like Bloodghast, Narcomoeba, and Prized Amalgam. By utilizing cards like Creeping Chill and Noxious Revival, the deck can deal damage to the opponent while maintaining control of the board. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Leyline of the Void and Force of Will to protect its game plan. With the ability to quickly fill the graveyard and generate value from it, this combo Dredge deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its relentless aggression and synergy.

The focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counter spells, removal, card advantage, and powerful planeswalkers in order to disrupt the opponent's strategy and take over the game. It aims to effectively manage resources, manipulate the game state, and eventually win through incremental advantage or by assembling a powerful combo. Key cards include Ancestral Recall, Force of Will, Tinker, and powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Karn, the Great Creator. The mana base enables the deck to consistently cast its spells and activate powerful abilities.

The Grixis Control deck focuses on using efficient spells and card advantage to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It aims to disrupt the opponent's plays with counterspells like Force of Will and Pyroblast, while also generating card advantage with cards like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. The deck includes powerful win conditions like Jace, Vryn's Prodigy and Narset, Parter of Veils, and has access to powerful mana acceleration with cards like Black Lotus and Mana Crypt. With a mix of disruption, card advantage, and powerful threats, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the Dark Depths combo using Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. The deck also utilizes cards like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Karn, the Great Creator to tutor for key pieces and disrupt opponents with cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Sphere of Resistance. The deck also includes artifact mana acceleration and disruption to support the combo strategy while utilizing cards like Leyline of the Void for graveyard hate and Mishra's Workshop for additional mana generation.

The deck focuses on using powerful artifacts and mana acceleration to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive threats. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Sphere of Resistance and Phyrexian Revoker, while also utilizing cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Lodestone Golem to generate advantage and control the board. The deck is able to quickly assemble a strong board presence and lock the opponent out of the game with cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere, ultimately overpowering the opponent with high-impact threats and disruptive elements.

This deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach to enable powerful combos and recursion. The deck includes a variety of powerful cards like Force of Will, Demonic Tutor, and Ancestral Recall to control the game and find key pieces. The main win condition is utilizing Brain Freeze to mill the opponent's library, taking advantage of the deck's ability to cast spells from the graveyard with Underworld Breach. The deck also includes disruption like Pyroblast and Flusterstorm to protect its game plan and disrupt the opponent's strategies.

The deck focuses on combining powerful draw spells and disruptive counterspells to control the game while deploying efficient threats like Monastery Mentor and Dreadhorde Arcanist to close out games quickly. By leveraging the card advantage provided by cards like Dack Fayden and Narset, Parter of Veils, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in order to establish an advantage and ultimately win through a combination of tempo and card advantage. Jeskai Xerox combines the best aspects of control and aggro strategies to create a versatile and adaptable gameplay style.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 deck focuses on utilizing powerful planeswalker cards to control the game and outvalue opponents. By including a variety of control cards like Force of Will and Pyroblast, along with disruptive creatures like Deathrite Shaman and Dreadhorde Arcanist, the deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies while building up its own resources. With a mix of card draw spells, removal, and mana acceleration from Moxen, the deck can quickly establish board presence and control the pace of the game. The inclusion of powerful spells like Time Walk and Ancestral Recall further solidify its advantage in longer matchups.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful spells and cards to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also maintaining card advantage and tempo through cantrips and card draw. It aims to quickly apply pressure on the opponent using efficient creatures like Dreadhorde Arcanist and Hullbreacher, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and counterspells like Force of Will. The deck capitalizes on its versatility and flexibility to adapt to different matchups and situations, aiming to outmaneuver opponents with its efficient spellcasting and strategic gameplay.

This deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies by using cards like Chalice of the Void, Ensnaring Bridge, Thorn of Amethyst, and Sphere of Resistance. It also looks to quickly drop threats like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Archon of Emeria to restrict opponents' abilities to cast spells. Additionally, the deck utilizes artifact mana acceleration like Moxen and Black Lotus to power out threats and disrupt opponents' game plans. The inclusion of Karn, the Great Creator allows for additional disruption and artifact synergies, making it difficult for opponents to execute their own game plans effectively.

This Vintage deck focuses on aggressive tactics and midrange strategy with a mix of blue, black, and green cards. It includes disruptive creatures like Collector Ouphe and Deathrite Shaman, along with powerful planeswalkers like Narset and Oko. The deck also contains a variety of efficient card draw spells and disruptive counterspells to control the game. It aims to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with removal spells and disruptive creatures. The mana base is designed to support the deck's multicolor requirements efficiently.

The deck aims to efficiently cast powerful spells from the graveyard using cards like Underworld Breach and Lion's Eye Diamond. It utilizes cheap cantrips and card draw to find combo pieces while disrupting opponents with counterspells and removal. The inclusion of Brain Freeze as a win condition, along with other storm cards, allows for explosive combo finishes. The deck can quickly assemble its combo while adapting to different game states through versatile spells and the ability to recur key cards from the graveyard.
